newsitem.title: USA: U.S. says Russia must proceed with economic reform.
newsitem.headline: U.S. says Russia must proceed with economic reform.

text.p: Russia must take action to make foreign investment "safer" if it wants strong economic growth, and the United States will work with Moscow to achieve this, National Security Adviser Sandy Berger said on Tuesday.

"There remain serious problems in the Russian economy that President (Boris) Yeltsin has addressed quite forcefully over the past few days," Berger told a press conference two days before President Clinton and Yeltsin begin a summit in Helsinki.
Yeltsin in recent days named young reformers to a new economic team, including his chief-of-staff, Anatoly Chubais, to head his new economic policy team.

"He has a new economic team, which is a vigorous one, and we want to work with him and with his economic team to promote trade and investment on which Russia's growth depends," Berger said. "If Russia does those things which make foreign investment safer and more stable and more secure, we believe that there is a very substantial amount of foreign investment that is interested in the Russian market," he said.
